Testing.history: The Bahrain International Circuit is renowned for its state-of-the-art design and was the first Formula 1 race held in the Middle East, debuting in 2004.
Testing.fun_fact: The circuit is surrounded by desert sands and features an artificial oasis.

Round 1.history: Albert Park Circuit in Melbourne has hosted the Australian Grand Prix since 1996, known for its mix of street and parkland sections.
Round 1.fun_fact: The track is constructed around a public park and is temporary.

Round 2.history: Shanghai International Circuit opened in 2004 and features one of the longest straights in F1.
Round 2.fun_fact: The track layout resembles the Chinese character 'shang', meaning 'high' or 'above'.

Round 3.history: Suzuka Circuit is an iconic track with a figure-eight layout and has hosted F1 races since 1987.
Round 3.fun_fact: Suzuka is known for its challenging 130R corner, considered one of the most difficult in F1.

Round 4.history: The Bahrain Grand Prix, first held in 2004, was the first Formula 1 race in the Middle East.
Round 4.fun_fact: The event is often held at night, creating a stunning spectacle under the lights.

Round 5.history: Jeddah Corniche Circuit is one of the newest tracks, debuting in 2021 as the fastest street circuit in F1.
Round 5.fun_fact: The circuit runs along the Red Sea, providing spectacular views.

Round 6.history: Miami International Autodrome is a relatively new circuit, first hosting the Miami Grand Prix in 2022.
Round 6.fun_fact: The circuit is built around the Hard Rock Stadium, home of the Miami Dolphins.

Round 7.history: Imola Circuit, officially named Autodromo Internazionale Enzo e Dino Ferrari, has a long history in F1 since 1980.
Round 7.fun_fact: Imola is known for its anti-clockwise layout, a rarity in F1.

Round 8.history: The Monaco Grand Prix, held since 1929, is one of the most prestigious and challenging tracks in F1.
Round 8.fun_fact: The circuit features tight corners and elevation changes, winding through the streets of Monte Carlo.

Round 9.history: The Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya has been a staple in F1 since 1991, known for its technical layout.
Round 9.fun_fact: The circuit is a popular testing venue due to its balanced layout.

Round 10.history: Circuit Gilles Villeneuve in Montreal has hosted the Canadian Grand Prix since 1978.
Round 10.fun_fact: The circuit is known for the 'Wall of Champions,' a notorious corner that has claimed many F1 drivers.

ROUND 11.history: Originally built in 1969, the track was revamped and renamed the A1-Ring before becoming the Red Bull Ring in 2011.
ROUND 11.fun_fact: The Red Bull Ring is known for its elevation changes and stunning Alpine backdrop.

ROUND 12.history: Silverstone hosted the first Formula 1 World Championship race in 1950. It has undergone multiple modifications since.
ROUND 12.fun_fact: The British Grand Prix at Silverstone is considered the 'home of Formula 1' due to its rich history.

ROUND 13.history: Spa is one of the oldest circuits in F1, debuting in 1925. Known for its challenging corners like Eau Rouge and Raidillon.
ROUND 13.fun_fact: The circuit is located in the Ardennes forest, leading to unpredictable weather conditions.

ROUND 14.history: Debuting in 1986, it was the first F1 race held behind the Iron Curtain.
ROUND 14.fun_fact: The Hungaroring is one of the most physically demanding circuits due to its tight and twisty layout.

ROUND 15.history: Zandvoort returned to the calendar in 2021 after a 36-year absence.
ROUND 15.fun_fact: The track's banked corners make it unique among modern F1 circuits.

ROUND 16.history: Known as the 'Temple of Speed,' Monza is one of the oldest tracks, hosting its first Grand Prix in 1922.
ROUND 16.fun_fact: Monza has the highest average speed of any F1 circuit.

ROUND 17.history: First hosted in 2016, this street circuit combines tight corners with long straights.
ROUND 17.fun_fact: The circuit passes the historic Maiden Tower and offers a mix of old and modern cityscapes.

ROUND 18.history: The first F1 night race was held here in 2008, setting a precedent for night racing.
ROUND 18.fun_fact: The Singapore GP is known for its stunning night-time cityscape and humid conditions.

ROUND 19.history: Debuted in 2012, it features elements inspired by iconic F1 circuits worldwide.
ROUND 19.fun_fact: The circuit's signature Turn 1 features a steep uphill climb followed by a sharp hairpin.

ROUND 20.history: First hosted in 1963, the circuit was revamped and returned in 2015.
ROUND 20.fun_fact: The circuit's high altitude makes it challenging for engines and drivers.

ROUND 21.history: Built in 1940, Interlagos is one of the most iconic circuits in F1, known for its passionate fans.
ROUND 21.fun_fact: Interlagos is one of the few circuits run counterclockwise.

ROUND 22.history: Debuted in 2023, this circuit is the latest addition to F1, running along the Las Vegas Strip.
ROUND 22.fun_fact: It features a glittering night race in the heart of the entertainment capital of the world.

ROUND 23.history: Originally built for MotoGP, it hosted its first F1 race in 2021.
ROUND 23.fun_fact: The track is surrounded by artificial lighting, making it perfect for night races.

ROUND 24.history: Debuted in 2009 as F1's first day-to-night race, featuring stunning views of Yas Island.
ROUND 24.fun_fact: The circuit's pit exit passes under the track through a tunnel.
